analysis

Class MultiFoldPMFConvolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • analysis.MultiFoldPMFConvolution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class MultiFoldPMFConvolution
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    class implements the n-fold convolution of any discrete mass probability function, for pmfs that are non-zero only in the non-negative integers, using the recursive definition of n-fold convolution defined in Hadley and Whitin (1963): Analysis of Inventory Systems, page 121. The class uses the popt4jlib.FiniteLRUFunctionCache class to speed up computations.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2021

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        test-driver program tests the class by computing n-fold convolution of the Negative Binomial distribution. Invoke as: java -cp <classpath> analysis.MultifoldPMFConvolution <lambda> <pl> <k> <n> . The program will return the value p(n)(k;λ,pl)
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
